Cyberbullying: With the rise of social media, children are at an increased risk of cyberbullying. This can lead to emotional distress, low self-esteem, and even suicide.
Privacy concerns: Children may unknowingly share personal information online, which can compromise their privacy and safety.
Exposure to inappropriate content: Children may have access to inappropriate content online, which can be harmful to their development and well-being.
Sleep disruptions: Exposure to screens, especially before bedtime, can disrupt sleep patterns and lead to sleep disorders.
Sedentary behavior: Spending too much time in front of screens can lead to a sedentary lifestyle, which can increase the risk of obesity and other health issues.
